data.title: Report: Amazon Eyes Buying Startup Wondery As Entry To Podcasts
data.text: Amazon is in talks to purchase of podcast maker Wondery, a startup that could help the tech giant push more into the burgeoning podcast sector, The Wall Street Journal (WSJ) reported Wednesday (Dec. 2). WSJ cited unnamed sources as saying the talks have valued Wondery at over $300 million — a big increase from the […]

data.title: Nevada wins eight more Amazon facilities
data.text: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) said Wednesday that it has recently opened or plans to open in 2021 eight fulfillment and delivery operations across Nevada. The eight facilities will bring to 19 the number of facilities that the Seattle-based e-tailer will operate across the state.

data.title: Amazon reportedly in talks to buy podcast startup Wondery
data.text: Amazon is in talks to buy podcast startup Wondery with a valuation of over $300 million, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter. Deal talks are ongoing and negotiations could still fall apart, the report said here.

data.title: Amazon In Talks To Buy Podcaster Wondery – Report
data.text: Amazon is in exclusive talks to acquire Wondery in a deal that values the podcaster at over $300 million, according to the Wall Street Journal, as the sector continues to be a hot one following SiriusXM buying Sticher, the New York Times acquiring Serial and Spotify absorbing Gimlet. data.title: Uber, JetBlue join Amazon-backed Climate Pledge
data.text: Amazon said Wednesday that five companies, including Uber and JetBlue, have joined its Climate Pledge, a commitment to be net-zero carbon by 2040. Chief Executive Officer Jeff Bezos last year pledged to make the largest US e-commerce company net carbon neutral by 2040, as employees and consumers around the world protested for broader moves to.

data.title: Amazon is reportedly considering buying Wondery in a deal that could value the podcast startup at $300 million (AMZN)
data.text: Amazon is considering buying the podcast startup Wondery, the Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday. Sources told the outlet that the early talks are exclusive and would signal the tech company's deeper foray into the consumer audio market. Wondery is the world's largest independent podcast producer, with more than 100 current podcasts — including its popular "Dirty John" show — and a total of 58 million streams or downloads, according to data analytics firm Podtrac. It's the sixth-largest podcast publisher in the US, with 8 million unique listeners as of October.

data.title: Amazon in talks to buy podcast startup Wondery for more than $300 million--WSJ
data.text: Amazon.com Inc. is in talks to buy podcast startup Wondery, according to a report in The Wall Street Journal. Citing people familiar with the matter, the talks value Wondery, which podcast shows include "Death of a Starlet," "Little Stories Everywhere" and "Jacked: Rise of the New Jack Sound," at over $300 million, the WSJ report said.

data.title: Uber, JetBlue join Amazon-backed Climate Pledge fund
data.text: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday that five companies, including Uber Technologies Inc and JetBlue Airways Corp, have joined its fund that invests in companies developing environmentally friendly technologies.

data.title: Uber, Rivian, JetBlue, Cabify, and Boom Supersonic Sign The Climate Pledge
data.text: SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Today, during Web Summit 2020, Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Global Optimism announced that Boom Supersonic, Cabify, JetBlue, Rivian, and Uber have joined The Climate Pledge, a commitment to be net-zero carbon by 2040—a decade ahead of the Paris Agreement's goal of 2050. Signatories to The Climate Pledge agree to: Measure and report greenhouse gas emissions on a regular basis; Implement decarbonization strategies in line with the Paris Agreement through real business chang

data.title: Amazon's (AMZN) AWS Extends Deal With Zoom, Boosts Clientele
data.text: Amazon's (AMZN) AWS and Zoom expand their partnership. Hence, the latter continues to use AWS' portfolio of services and develop new solutions.

data.title: Amazon Continues Investment in Nevada with Thousands of Jobs to Support Operations
data.text: SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) today announced its continued investment in Nevada with eight new buildings across the state to support customer fulfillment and delivery operations. The sites are expected to create more than 2,000 permanent full- and part-time jobs with a minimum $15 per hour wage and comprehensive benefits starting on day one. data.title: EU's Crackdown on Big Tech
data.text: Dec.02 -- The European Union is set to unveil sweeping legislation adding to the regulation facing internet companies, such as Amazon, Alphabet and Facebook. The tech giants are warning the new rules may hinder innovation and are holding a video call with EU officials later today.
